message: Dear Fellow Geeks, I need a script to stop display on a windows tablet browser, to switch to portrait view when tablet is held in vertical position. Thanks in advance. Eid Mubarak bardoo!

data.message:
I don't think you can control that since it's a device behavior but look at this one. 

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5298467/prevent-orientation-change-in-ios-safari

I saw that.. will it work on a WINDOWS tablet though? The problem is detecting the browser orientation, in this case its not a mobile browser, but a Windows 8 browser (which is not a mobile one). In essence it doesn't work like a mobile iOS browser. Anyway.. will give it a try. :-)

To detect metro IE, you can try the "Win64" method from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8751479/javascript-detect-metro-ui-version-of-ie - it seems the most reasonable to me as I think nobody runs desktop IE x64
I believe you wanna do something weird. Can you tell us what's the real problem you are trying to fix? :D
